DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether pharmacologic inhibition Toll-like receptor 4 ( TLR4 ) eritoran injection ( E5564 ) prevent lipid-induced insulin resistance lean , normal glucose tolerant ( NGT ) subject .
DOC.brief_title: The Role TLR4 Lipid-induced Insulin Resistance
DOC.criteria: Subjects capable give informed consent . lean ( BMI < 26 kg/m2 ) normal glucosetolerant subject ( completers ) without family history Type 2 diabetes mellitus ( DM ) Both gender . ( 50 % male ) Age = 1865 year . Older subject exclude age proinflammatory state . All ethnic group Premenopausal woman follicular phase , nonlactating , negative pregnancy test . Postmenopausal woman stable dose expose hormone replacement > =6 month . Lab : Hematocrit > =34 % , serum creatinine < =1.4 mg/dL , normal electrolyte , urinalysis , coagulation test . Liver function test 2x normal range . Stable body weight ( +/1 % ) > =3 month . One less session strenuous exercise/wk last 6 month . Presence diabetes impaired glucose tolerance base ADA criterion ; Current treatment drug know affect glucose lipid homeostasis . Subjects stable dose statin ( > 3months ) eligible . Nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug systemic steroid use 1 week within 3 month . Current treatment anticoagulant ( warfarin ) . Aspirin ( 325 mg ) clopidogrel permit hold seven day prior biopsy . History heart disease ( New York Heart Classification great class II ; nonspecific STT wave change ECG ) , peripheral vascular disease , pulmonary disease , smoker . Poorly control blood pressure ( systolic BP > 160 , diastolic BP > 90 mmHg ) . Active inflammatory , autoimmune , infectious , hepatic , gastrointestinal , malignant , psychiatric disease .
